#Homework 7

```{r 'Create Table'}
ageIQ <- tibble::tribble(
    ~Age,~IQ,
   23L,100L,
   18L,105L,
    10L,95L,
   45L,120L
  )
ageIQ.s  <- cbind(ageIQ,Sums=rowSums(ageIQ))
ageIQ.s <- rbind(ageIQ.s,Sums=colSums(ageIQ.s))
summary(ageIQ)
```

## 1
<div class="q">Plot these four points using R.</div>
```{r '1'}
ggplot(data = ageIQ,mapping=aes(x=Age,y=IQ))+
geom_point()+
geom_smooth(method=lm)+
  ggtitle("Age V IQ")+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
```

## 2
<div class="q">Calculate the covariance between age and IQ.</div>
<div class="a">A)
$\textrm{Cov}(x,y) = \frac{1}{(n-1) } \sum_{i} (x_{i} - \bar{x})(y_{i} - \bar{y})$  
$\textrm{Cov}(x,y) = \frac{1}{(4-1) } \sum_{i} [(23 - 24)(100 - 105)+(18 - 24)(105 - 105)+...+(45 - 24)(120 - 105)]$  
$\textrm{Cov}(x,y) = 153.\bar3$  
</div>
```{r '2'}
ageIQ.cov <- ageIQ %>% 
  mutate(S=(Age-mean(ageIQ$Age))*(IQ-mean(ageIQ$IQ))) %>% colSums()
ageIQ.cov[3]/3
```
## 3
<div class="q">Calculate their correlation. What does the number you get indicate?</div>
<div class="a">A)
$r = \frac{\textrm{Cov}(x,y)}{s_{x} s_{y}}$  
$r = \frac{153.\bar3}{ 14.9\bar8)(10.80123)}$  
$r = .947$  
The closeness of the r value to 1 indicates a strong positive correlation between age & IQ.
</div>
```{r '3'}
(r <- 153.33333/(sd(ageIQ$Age)*sd(ageIQ$IQ)))
```
## 4
<div class="q">Calculate the regression coefficients $\beta_0$ and $\beta_1$ and write out the equation of the best-fit line relating age and IQ.</div>
<div class="a">A)
$r = \frac{\textrm{Cov}(x,y)}{ s_{x} s_{y}}   = \beta_{1} \frac{s_{x}}{s_{y}}$  
$\frac{r}{\frac{s_x}{s_y}}=\beta_1$  
$\beta_1=\frac{0.9470957}{\frac{14.9\bar8}{10.80123}}$
$\beta_1=0.6824926$
$\beta_{0} =  \bar{y} - \beta_{1} \bar{x}$  
$\beta_{0} =  105 - 0.6824926*24$  
$\beta_{0} =  88.62018$ 
Line of best fit:
$\hat{y}_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x_i$  
$\hat{y}_i = 88.62018 + 0.6824926x_i$  
</div>
```{r}
(b1 <- r/(sd(ageIQ$Age)/sd(ageIQ$IQ)))
(b0 <- mean(ageIQ$IQ)-b1*mean(ageIQ$Age))
```
